Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> look at the command z_exportviewingkey. you may be able to let others view all transactions after the game, leaving maximum loss at one game's worth. or you could publish the private key and make a new z-addr every week, which might be easier for anyone to import and look at the results. you'll have to explain to people how to import the key if you do that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <jr.trump> I also say that I will try to do it in the most transparent way possible, showing each ID of transactions (that even though you can not see the amount or address to which they go, but yes, you can see the date and time), I will also publish the payment information and I will show a capture of the balance of that address with the calculations made. If people wanted, I would not mind doing an online excel so that each incoming transaction can be checked starting at 4:59 PM, as well as the payment exit transaction.
As I said, I do not think that they play more than 10 VRSC per day, since each person will only play once and to play 10 VRSC they would have to play 100 people and 10 VRSC are approximately 1-2 $, so they do not. I think nobody bothers to do something to scam 1-2 $

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jr.trump> Yes, I have no problem in giving the private key of the address after the game, as well as the data that people want, as I said, I can put everything in a public excel so that you enter and see everything after the game ends

[dscrdvrsc] <Scrotum Tickler> @miketout       I tried this line " z_exportwallet export_exportdir=/ Local Disk C:/Users/Owner/AppData/Roaming/Komodo/VRSC"  in the CLI to export but it wont  work and I get this message "CLI response:
wrong cli string format"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Scrotum Tickler> What am I doing wrong?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> you can only set exportdir in the VRSC.conf, as explained in the faq

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> commands are above as shown

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Scrotum Tickler> I have entered the z_exportwallet_ command with the FILENAME as    /LOCAL_PATH/Local Disk C:/Users/Owner/AppData/Roaming/Komodo/VRSC    and the  CLI response is still  wrong cli string format. Any idea what I am doing wrong here?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <miketout> z_exportwallet filename
and to import:
z_importwallet filename
exact command with underscore and no folder name, just file. exportdir, which is the folder for the file must be set in VRSC.conf

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jr.trump> Ok I just reviewed and the installation part is not in the version of Verus, you just have to download the wallet from the Verus website, use "sudo apt-get install libc6-i386 libgconf-2-4 libcurl3", unzip the wallet and then you run with "./Agama"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <CHMEX> Block reward starts with a linear ramp, changing every block, for the first 10,080 blocks (1 week) going from 0 to the peak reward of 384. From that point forward, block reward will halve monthly for the following 5 months, then every 2 years after that. All block rewards, whether mined or staked, with a reward above or equal to 192 VRSC will be time locked for a random release time between block 129,600 and 1,181,520 (3 months to 2 years and 3 months after genesis). bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4070404.0
